properties.Name: Ledger
properties.Description:
A ledger is a group of accounts.

It is the complete set of accounts for a business entity.

There is no standard form for a ledger as long as it records debts and credits to each account.

Transactions may be recorded either to a single ledger ('General Ledger') or to subsidiary ledgers and then subsequently recorded to the General Ledger.

It is the book of secondary or final entry after the initial or first entry into a journal, which are then posted to the ledger.

Columns.Name: LedgerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Ledger.

Columns.Name: LegalEntityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Legal Entity.

Columns.Name: LedgerTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Ledger Type.

Columns.Name: AccountingFrameworkId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Accounting Framework.

Properties.Description:
A ledger is a group of accounts.

It is the complete set of accounts for a business entity.

There is no standard form for a ledger as long as it records debts and credits to each account.

Transactions may be recorded either to a single ledger ('General Ledger') or to subsidiary ledgers and then subsequently recorded to the General Ledger.

It is the book of secondary or final entry after the initial or first entry into a journal, which are then posted to the ledger.
